abstract: The bank is under investigation in Philadelphia and California and is accused of flouting federal laws with its sale of subprime mortgage securities.
snippet: The bank is under investigation in Philadelphia and California and is accused of flouting federal laws with its sale of subprime mortgage securities.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase disclosed on Wednesday that it faced a criminal and civil investigation into whether it sold shoddy mortgage securities to investors in the run-up to the financial crisis, the latest legal threat to the nation’s biggest bank.

headline.main: JPMorgan Reveals It Faces Criminal and Civil Inquiries
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Faces Civil And Criminal Inquiries

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess

abstract: Allowing the nation’s largest banks to own physical commodities increases both their power and their potential to disrupt the economy, an economist writes.
snippet: Allowing the nation’s largest banks to own physical commodities increases both their power and their potential to disrupt the economy, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: Getting Big Banks Out of the Commodities Business

abstract: JPMorgan Chase faces criminal and civil investigations into sales of mortgage securities. | Hilton Worldwide, the hotel company owned by the Blackstone Group, has begun preparations for an I.P.O. | Carl C. Icahn is bolstering his assault on the Dell buyout effort.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase faces criminal and civil investigations into sales of mortgage securities. | Hilton Worldwide, the hotel company owned by the Blackstone Group, has begun preparations for an I.P.O. | Carl C. Icahn is bolstering his assault on the De...
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase disclosed in a regulatory filing on Wednesday that it faced a criminal and civil investigation into whether it sold shoddy mortgage securities to investors before the financial crisis, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess report in DealBook. The investigation is the latest legal threat to the bank and one of several mortgage-related problems for the industry.

abstract: Such an admission in a civil case against JPMorgan, related to the so-called London Whale trading loss, would set an important precedent for regulators.
snippet: Such an admission in a civil case against JPMorgan, related to the so-called London Whale trading loss, would set an important precedent for regulators.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:56 p.m. | Federal regulators are seeking to level civil charges against JPMorgan Chase and extract a rare admission of wrongdoing from the nation’s biggest bank as an investigation into a multibillion-dollar trading loss enters its final stage.

headline.main: S.E.C. Is Said to Press JPMorgan for an Admission of Wrongdoing
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Is Said to Press JPMorgan for an Admission of Wrongdoing

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
